TITLE: Putin's Orthodox Christmas cease-fire begins, but is rejected as a cynical ploy by Ukraine and its allies
SUMMARY: The 36-hour truce declared by Russia came into effect at midday Moscow time (4 a.m. ET), but Kyiv dismissed the suggestion of a pause in the hostilities for the holiday

TITLE: House speaker vote highlights: McCarthy elected speaker on 15th ballot after making concessions to far-right rebels
SUMMARY: McCarthy prevailed early Saturday after he was able to whittle away hard-liners who opposed him over 14 rounds of voting

TITLE: South Carolina Supreme Court strikes down state abortion ban
SUMMARY: The decision marked a significant victory for abortion rights’ advocates suddenly forced to find safeguards at the state level after the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in June

TITLE: The House speaker election, in three charts
SUMMARY: It’s been more than 200 years since a speaker election went this many rounds

TITLE: Conservative leader Matt Schlapp is accused of fondling a male campaign staffer
SUMMARY: The Herschel Walker campaign aide said the conservative leader groped him without his consent in October

TITLE: Canada and the U.S. both face labor shortages. One country is increasing immigration.
SUMMARY: Canada’s government plans to accept 1.45 million immigrants by 2025, many with badly needed job skills. In the U.S., immigration legislation is stalled

TITLE: Congress has failed for over two decades to reform immigration — here's a timeline
SUMMARY: The outlook for any meaningful immigration reform in the new Congress is bleak

TITLE: Video shows border agents, police arresting migrants sleeping outside church shelter in El Paso ahead of Biden's visit
SUMMARY: Immigration advocates say the proximity of the arrests to a church shelter may violate the Biden administration's own policies

TITLE: Indiana Rep. Jim Banks announces bid for Braun's Senate seat
SUMMARY: The staunch Trump ally announced his bid for the seat that fellow Republican Mike Braun is vacating to run for governor

TITLE: Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar get committee assignments after Democrats kicked them off
SUMMARY: While holding the majority in 2021, House Democrats removed Greene and Gosar from their assigned committees because of controversial posts they made on social media

TITLE: Losing GOP candidate arrested in string of shootings at New Mexico Democrats' homes
SUMMARY: Albuquerque police announced the arrest of Solomon Peña and said that he had expressed anger over his loss in November and alleged that election fraud had played a role

TITLE: Embattled Rep. Santos awarded seats on Science and Small Business committees
SUMMARY: Some Republicans had called for the New York Republican to be barred from all committees after he lied about major parts of his personal biography

TITLE: Matt Schlapp slapped with a lawsuit after an allegation of fondling a GOP operative
SUMMARY: The male GOP staffer, who remains unnamed in the lawsuit, said the conservative movement leader groped him in a car without his consent

TITLE: Puerto Rico on its way to privatizing power generation despite widespread skepticism
SUMMARY: Critics worry the process could further delay Puerto Rico’s transition to renewable energy and still not bring access to reliable electricity to an island riddled with power outages

TITLE: West must ramp up aid to Ukraine to keep war with Russia from becoming a stalemate, U.K. foreign secretary says
SUMMARY: “We can’t allow this to drag on and become a kind of First World War attritional-type stalemate,” said James Cleverly

TITLE: Capitol Police investigated more than 7,500 threats against lawmakers last year
SUMMARY: The number of threat investigations in 2022 dipped for the first time in years, but it was still elevated and almost double the amount from 2017

TITLE: Solomon Pena was belligerent to neighbors who opposed his political views, condo official says
SUMMARY: The failed GOP candidate for local office is accused of hiring four people to shoot at the homes of Democratic leaders in Albuquerque, New Mexico

TITLE: What the 21 McCarthy holdouts got in committee assignments
SUMMARY: Nearly two dozen House Republicans prevented Kevin McCarthy from quickly securing the speaker’s gavel. Some made out better than others in committee seats

TITLE: Fireworks in House after Democrat says 'insurrectionists' should be banned from leading Pledge of Allegiance
SUMMARY: A routine House Judiciary Committee meeting erupted into a nearly hourlong heated debate Wednesday over the Pledge of Allegiance

TITLE: AP African American studies course is watered down after pressure from Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis
SUMMARY: In the revised syllabus for the course, the College Board made substantial revisions to sections criticized by the Florida Republican's administration

TITLE: Michigan Republicans are in turmoil as their leaders navigate tricky Trump terrain
SUMMARY: Republicans are now completely out of power in the Midwest battleground state and struggling to settle on a path forward

TITLE: GOP Rep. Andy Biggs announces articles of impeachment against DHS Secretary Mayorkas
SUMMARY: The Arizonan unsuccessfully introduced articles of impeachment against Alejandro Mayorkas in 2021, when Democrats controlled the House

SUMMARY: The FBI searched the house after documents with classified markings from the Obama administration were found in Biden’s Wilmington residence and a Washington think tank office

TITLE: Republicans quash Democratic ban on carrying guns in a congressional committee room
SUMMARY: A Democratic amendment to ban firearms from the hearing room for the GOP-led House Natural Resources Committee sparked a contentious debate Wednesday

TITLE: Connecticut Latino lawmakers propose banning 'Latinx,' calling it 'offensive'
SUMMARY: The bill's sponsor, state Rep. Geraldo Reyes Jr., says Spanish language "defaults to 'Latino'" for everybody, while supporters of Latinx say the gendered term 'Latino' is exclusionary

SUMMARY: At a House Oversight Committee hearing Wednesday, members from both parties cited an NBC News report about a group linked to China's government stealing millions

TITLE: Gas stove debate reignites as Energy Department proposes new standards
SUMMARY: In a move that's likely to inflame critics, the proposal seeks certain efficiency thresholds for both gas and electric stoves

TITLE: Pence’s home searched by FBI, one classified document found
SUMMARY: FBI agents searched former Vice President Mike Pence’s Indiana home, removing “one document with classified markings and six additional pages,” according to Pence’s spokesman. NBC News’ Garrett Haake has more details on the investigation.&nbsp

TITLE: In Texas lawsuit seeking to reverse FDA approval of abortion pills, state attorneys general weigh in
SUMMARY: A decision from a Trump-appointed judge could come later this month in a lawsuit alleging that the FDA’s approval of two abortion medications was unlawful

SUMMARY: A state agency filed an ethics lawsuit against a Republican county clerk, who allegedly mishandled ballots and a Taser

SUMMARY: A White House official indicated no interview was in the works after a Fox Corp. spokesperson said FOX Soul would interview the president for Super Bowl Sunday

SUMMARY: The spy balloon isn't the focus of the new House committee on China, but it underscores the military, economic and technological threat from Beijing, Republicans and Democrats say

TITLE: Utah's GOP governor defends new ban on gender-affirming care
SUMMARY: Gov. Spencer Cox said that the state Legislature does not have enough information and evidence to allow the treatment in an interview on NBC News' "Meet the Press

SUMMARY: The unidentified object the U.S. shot down Sunday over Lake Huron was the fourth taken down over North America in less than two weeks

SUMMARY: Cuts to entitlements should be "on the table," the former vice president and possible White House hopeful said on CNBC

TITLE: Arizona House GOP votes to restrict secretaries of state from overseeing their own elections
SUMMARY: The bill was introduced last year when Gov. Katie Hobbs, a Democrat, was secretary of state while running for governor

TITLE: Democratic governors launch alliance to protect abortion access
SUMMARY: 20 governors led by Gavin Newsom of California formed the Reproductive Freedom Alliance to allow members to share model legislation and potential executive orders

TITLE: Namibian dancers, president welcome Jill Biden to Africa
SUMMARY: The first lady’s trip is part of a commitment by President Joe Biden to deepen U.S. engagement with the fast-growing region

SUMMARY: The Russian leader made the comments in an address to mark Thursday’s Defender of the Fatherland Day, ahead of the first anniversary of his war in Ukraine

TITLE: Biden bets big that voters will reward him in 2024 for new bridge and road projects
SUMMARY: With little hope of passing major legislation in the next two years, Biden figures to run for re-election on the massive infrastructure package he's getting off the ground

TITLE: Ex-Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan won't challenge Trump in 2024
SUMMARY: “I would never run for president to sell books or position myself for a Cabinet role," the Republican former governor wrote in The New York Times

TITLE: Trump is 'not going to be the nominee' in 2024, N.H. Gov. Chris Sununu says
SUMMARY: The Republican, who has said he is considering a White House bid, also said Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis would win his state if the election were to take place now

TITLE: Kellyanne and George Conway announce divorce
SUMMARY: The Conways said in a statement that they were in the final stages of an amicable divorce

SUMMARY: The field of candidates are taking shape nearly 19 months out from election day. President Biden paid tribute to the heroes of Bloody Sunday in Selma and spoke on voting rights and democracy. Meanwhile, former President Trump gave a lengthy speech on Saturday at CPAC, laying out the framework of his campaign

TITLE: In Selma, Biden says right to vote remains under assault
SUMMARY: “The right to vote ... to have your vote counted is the threshold of democracy and liberty. With it anything’s possible,” the president tells the anniversary crowd

SUMMARY: The first lady said she and President Joe Biden, 80, would "never" discuss his taking a mental competency test due to his age

TITLE: D.C. Council chair says he's withdrawing the crime bill Congress plans to overturn

SUMMARY: The Conservative Political Action Conference was heavy on support for Trump, as many other rising GOP stars stayed away

TITLE: Senate confirms Eric Garcetti as U.S. ambassador to India after rocky nomination
SUMMARY: Garcetti will be the first permanent ambassador to India under President Biden after delays and drama over the nominee. As some Democrats defected, several Republicans voted yes

TITLE: DeSantis attempts to revoke Miami hotel's liquor license over drag show
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' administration filed a complaint against the Hyatt Regency Miami hotel, citing a 1947 state Supreme Court case on lewdness

TITLE: History-making Latina politician Gloria Molina announces she has terminal cancer
SUMMARY: Molina, 74, broke barriers as the first Latina elected to several legislative positions in California. "People both revered her and feared her," a political scientist said

TITLE: Judge appears sympathetic to abortion pill challenge in consequential Texas hearing
SUMMARY: Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk said he'd issue his decision "as soon as possible" about a request to ban the drug mifepristone while the trial proceeds

TITLE: Russian leadership approved aggressive actions of jets that damaged U.S. drone, U.S. officials say
SUMMARY: One official said he had not gotten indications that the signoff went all the way up to President Putin

TITLE: Personal info from data breach that affected lawmakers appears on hacker site
SUMMARY: Senate staffers were sent an email warning that data from the DC Health Link breach, including users' birthdates and Social Security numbers, can be found online

TITLE: Sharp drop in illegal border crossings continued in February, U.S. says
SUMMARY: U.S. Border Patrol officials encountered migrants 128,877 times trying to cross the border between legal border crossings in February

TITLE: Idaho governor signs firing squad execution bill into law
SUMMARY: The Legislature passed the measure March 20 with a veto-proof majority. Under it, firing squads will be used only if the state cannot obtain the drugs needed for lethal injections

TITLE: Awaiting possible indictment, Trump rallies in Waco and vows to 'destroy the deep state'
SUMMARY: Trump railed against the government officials investigating him, vowing to remove "the thugs and criminals who are corrupting our justice system" if he is elected again

TITLE: McConnell released from inpatient physical therapy
SUMMARY: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, 81, was at a private dinner at the Waldorf Astoria in Washington when he tripped and fell. He'll work from home for the next few days

TITLE: Race dominates final days of the mayoral election in deeply segregated Chicago
SUMMARY: Paul Vallas, a white moderate with a tough-on-crime-agenda, faces Brandon Johnson, a Black progressive with the support of the Chicago Teachers Union

TITLE: Senate Banking Committee faces intense 2024 politics in bank collapse hearings
SUMMARY: The roster includes red-state Democrats like Chairman Sherrod Brown, who is eyeing re-election, as well as enigmatic Arizona independent Kyrsten Sinema and the GOP Senate campaign chief

TITLE: Trump lawyer calls post attacking Bragg 'ill-advised,' says 'I'm not his social media consultant'
SUMMARY: "I think that was an ill-advised post that one of his social media people put up,” Joe Tacopina said on NBC News’ “Meet the Press

TITLE: Amateur fraud hunters bury election officials in public records requests
SUMMARY: 15 months after the 2020 election, officials say private citizens out to try to prove Trump's false claims of a stolen election are overwhelming their days with paperwork

TITLE: Ro Khanna endorses Barbara Lee's Senate campaign, announces he won't run
SUMMARY: The California progressive said will he be a co-chair of Lee's campaign

TITLE: A liberal just won the Wisconsin Supreme Court race. Republicans are already talking about impeaching her.
SUMMARY: A GOP win in the state Senate's 8th District gave the party a supermajority — with the power to pursue impeachment of newly elected liberal Janet Protasiewicz

TITLE: Exonerated Central Park Five member mocks Trump with ad of his own after indictment
SUMMARY: Yusef Salaam shared the open letter Tuesday night on Twitter

TITLE: Donald Trump calls for defunding federal police after his arrest in New York
SUMMARY: Trump and a handful of allies in the Republican-led House favor cutting money for the Justice Department and the FBI ahead of a Sept. 30 deadline to fund the government

TITLE: Defying China, McCarthy stands united with Taiwan's president
SUMMARY: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s meeting in California with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen drew objections from Beijing, which views it as support for the island’s independence

TITLE: North Dakota advances record-setting 10 anti-LGBTQ bills in one day, advocates say
SUMMARY: The slate of legislation includes a bill that would prohibit some drag performances in public places and another that would restrict transition-related care for minors

TITLE: Trump responds to arraignment, slams DA and judge
SUMMARY: Former President Trump slammed the Manhattan DA and the judge, saying, “Our justice system has become lawless,” in response to being charged with 34 felony counts of falsifying business records. Trump has pleaded not guilty. NBC News’ Garrett Haake has the latest

TITLE: Trump calls for defunding the FBI and Justice Department after arrest
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump was arraigned Tuesday on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records related to hush money payments made in 2016

TITLE: White House accuses GOP of helping Mexican drug cartels by targeting ATF
SUMMARY: A Republican-led effort to abolish the federal gun agency has created a political opening for the White House as it looks to fend off soft-on-crime attacks

TITLE: Ex-Fox News producer Abby Grossberg has been subpoenaed by Smartmatic in its lawsuit against Fox
SUMMARY: The voting machine company has filed a $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox for its coverage of baseless election fraud charges in the 2020 election

TITLE: U.S. lawmakers arrive in Taiwan as China blasts McCarthy's meeting with Tsai
SUMMARY: Rep. Michael McCaul, head of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, is leading a bipartisan congressional delegation to the island as its president returns from the U.S
